snippet: Doctors Without Borders said it had drastically scaled back operations at an airport encampment in Bangui, the capital, because of a growing political and sectarian crisis.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders says it has drastically curtailed operations at airport encampment in the Central African Republic, where violence has imperiled about 100,000 displaced people taking refuge.
lead_paragraph: Doctors Without Borders said it had drastically scaled back operations at an airport encampment in Bangui, the capital, because of a growing political and sectarian crisis.

headline.main: Central African Republic: Violence Forces Aid Group to Curtail Work
headline.print_headline: Central African Republic: Violence Forces Aid Group to Curtail Work
